channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: I tested Dell’s compact Chromebook, and it’s a great tool for school – but you’ll want to pair it with a mouse
item.description: The Dell Chromebook 3120 is billed as the perfect companion for educational purposes – but is it fit for the classroom?

item.title: I just tested the best cheap Chromebook I’ve seen so far – and I’m amazed by one aspect in particular
item.description: The Asus Chromebook CX1505 certainly offers a lot of screen for the money, but has it been compromised elsewhere?

item.title: Wait, people actually use Facebook Dating?
item.description: Meta said that Facebook Dating has 1.77 million daily active users in the US between ages 18-29.

item.title: This might be one of the best value 1080p gaming laptops I’ve tested – if you can put up with a few missteps
item.description: The Medion Erazer Deputy 15 P1 makes a pitch for superb 1080p gaming at a reasonable price.

item.title: Augmented reality may be the key to fire safety
item.description: Immersive, personalized technology can transform how families prepare for emergencies. House fires burn hotter and spread faster than ever before, leaving families with as little as two minutes to safely escape their homes. Despite that short window to reach safety, families are startlingly unprepared: Only 26% of American families have developed and practiced a home fire escape plan....

item.title: ‘These Horrible Objects Are Illegal’: French Authorities Discover Alleged Child Sex Dolls on Shein
item.description: Shein has banned all sex dolls in response to France's threats to ban the platform.

item.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp Thinks the Haters Are ‘Confounded’ By His Success
item.description: Palantir had some impressive quarterly earnings. Karp celebrated by publishing a manifesto.
